dt: {bc}used, done, belonging to, or experienced by two or more individuals

dt.t: a dormitory with a {wi}shared{/wi} living area
FDOT public information officer Rebecca Leigh White said pre-existing road constraints and rights of way mean cyclists and motorists will have to use {wi}shared{/wi} lanes throughout the extension.
Their {wi}shared{/wi} project, the Gottman Institute, combines his theory with her practice.
I thought back to the long years of conflict, but also to the deep, {wi}shared{/wi} passion for the art of cooking, eating, and offering hospitality.

dt: {bc}accessible by more than one user or process

dt.t: Despite the {wi}shared{/wi} memory, the PC performed relatively well …

shortdef: used, done, belonging to, or experienced by two or more individuals
accessible by more than one user or process

dt: {bc}to partake of, use, experience, occupy, or enjoy with others

dt.t: … anyone you {wi}share{/wi} a link with can {wi}share{/wi} that link with someone else if they choose.

dt: {bc}to post (something) on a {d_link|social media|social media} platform

dt.t: Fans were also quick to screenshot and {wi}share{/wi} the photo.
The collective mind-set feels akin to that old adage about a tree falling in the forest: If you don't {wi}share{/wi} it on Instagram, did it even happen?
It pulls in words and pictures from news and blog feeds as well as from links that your pals {wi}share{/wi} on Facebook and Twitter.

dt: {bc}to grant or give a share in

dt.t: {it}shared{/it} the last of her water with us

dt: {bc}to tell (thoughts, feelings, experiences, etc.) to others

dt.t: {it}shared{/it} out the land among his heirs
we all {it}shared{/it} in the fruits of our labor

dt: {bc}to apportion and take shares of something
{bc}to talk about one's thoughts, feelings, or experiences with others

pt: {sc}share{/sc} {sc}participate{/sc} {sc}partake{/sc} mean to have, get, or use in common with another or others. {sc}share{/sc} usually implies that one as the original holder grants to another the partial use, enjoyment, or possession of a thing.
{sc}participate{/sc} implies a having or taking part in an undertaking, activity, or discussion.
{sc}partake{/sc} implies accepting or acquiring a share especially of food or drink.

shortdef: to partake of, use, experience, occupy, or enjoy with others

dt: {bc}the practice of sleeping in the same bed with one's child

dt.t: Now the practice of {wi}bed sharing{/wi} appears to be coming back into favor again—and a close look at the science suggests that the context in which parents do it, and the choices they make beforehand, matter a lot in terms of safety.
More and more parents are sleeping next to their infants—the percentage of {wi}bed-sharing{/wi} babies has more than doubled in recent years …

utxt.t: Studies have found that the risk of SIDS [{d_link|sudden infant death syndrome|sudden infant death syndrome}] increases anywhere from two to tenfold when parents {wi}bed-share{/wi}, depending on the bed-sharing situation and the age of the baby.

shortdef: the practice of sleeping in the same bed with one's child

dt: {bc}joint ownership or rental of a vacation lodging (such as a condominium) by several persons with each occupying the premises in turn for short periods
{bc}simultaneous use of a central computer by many users at remote locations

shortdef: joint ownership or rental of a vacation lodging (such as a condominium) by several persons with each occupying the premises in turn for short periods
simultaneous use of a central computer by many users at remote locations

dt: {bc}to divide (something) into parts and give the parts to different people

dt.t: In her will, she {it}shared out{/it} her property to her nephews and nieces.

shortdef: to divide (something) into parts and give the parts to different people
